content: आडंबरः [आ-डंब्-क्षेपे, अरन्] {@--1@} Pride, arrogance. {@--2@} Show; means, external appendage; विरचितनारसिंहरूपाडंबरं <ls>K. 5</ls>, <ls n="K.">309</ls>; निर्गुणः शोभते नैव विपुलाडंबरोपि ना <ls>Bv. 1. 115.</ls> {@--3@} The sounding of a trumpet as a sign of attack. {@--4@} Commencement. {@--5@} Fury, anger, passion; दंतिनामाडंबररवेण <ls>K. 114.</ls> {@--6@} Happiness, pleasure. {@--7@} The roaring of clouds and of elephants; <ls>Bv. 1. 4.</ls> {@--8@} The eyelid. {@--9@} A drum used in a battle. {@--10@} (Hence) A charge sounded by musical instruments; the din or uproar of the battle. --रं Rubbing and kneading the body.
